summary: Paul Merson restarted his row with Andros Townsend after Townsend was brought on with only seven minutes remaining in Tottenham's 0-0 draw with Burnley. Merson initially angered Townsend for writing that 'if Andros Townsend can get in (the England team) then it opens it up to anybody.' Merson was proven wrong when Townsend scored for England against Italy and Merson admitted his mistake. Townsend hit back at Merson on Twitter after scoring for England. Merson had another dig at Townsend after Tottenham drew at Turf Moor.

Chelsea have made an offer for FC Tokyo's 22-year-old forward Yoshinori Muto. If he completes the move, he will join Chelsea's Dutch partner club Vitesse Arnhem on loan next season. Chelsea's interest in Muto is not connected to their sponsorship deal with Yokohama Rubber. Muto has 11 international caps for Japan and has scored once for them. He recently graduated from Keio University with an economics degree. A £4million deal has been suggested. Muto has not yet decided if he will join Chelsea.

A study found that babies given antibiotics in the first six months of life are more likely to be fat as toddlers. Researchers suggest that antibiotics may be contributing to the obesity epidemic. By two years old, one in five boys and one in ten girls were overweight or obese, and children who had taken antibiotics as babies were more likely to be overweight. The study did not prove that antibiotics cause weight gain, but it may be because they kill off gut bacteria that would normally feed on some of the food eaten.

A Buckingham Palace guard slipped and fell on a manhole cover while taking his position in his sentry box during the Changing of the Guard. The guard lost his footing, slid sideways, knocked his bearskin, and dropped his rifle. The incident was caught on camera by a tourist. The guard quickly got up, embarrassed, as his colleagues marched past. The guard is thought to have slipped because of the metal protectors on his boots.

The miniseries "Roots," which originally aired in 1977, is being remade by A&E, Lifetime, and History. The new miniseries will be a simulcast and will tell the story of Kunta Kinte, an African who was captured and sold into slavery. LeVar Burton, who played Kinte in the original, will co-executive produce the new version, which will draw more from Alex Haley's novel. The producers will consult scholars for authenticity. The remake is intended for both fans of the original and a new generation of viewers.

A former royal footman, Christopher Lawler, claims that palace aides tried to force him into an orgy at Clarence House in 1978. He said he was pinned to a chair and groped by a male member of staff on his first day. His complaints were initially ignored, but police are now investigating.

An Oregon couple, Jesse and Melissa Meek, announced they are expecting a child in a rap video set to the theme from 'The Fresh Prince of Bel-Air'. The video, which features the couple rapping in a car, has been viewed over 1.7 million times on YouTube. The video was made so loved ones living far away could know about the baby. At the end of the video, the Meeks share a sonogram of their unborn child.

A dress worn by Vivien Leigh as Scarlett O'Hara in Gone With the Wind sold for $137,000 at auction. The dress, a jacket and skirt ensemble, was worn in several key scenes of the 1939 film. The dress was originally slate blue-gray but has faded to light gray. It was part of a collection of over 300,000 items amassed by James Tumblin, who bought the dress for $20. Other items from the film were also sold at the auction, including a hat worn by Leigh, a suit worn by Clark Gable, and a bonnet worn by both Leigh and Olivia De Havilland.

A two-year-old boy fell into a cheetah exhibit at the Cleveland Metroparks Zoo after his parents dangled him over the edge. The child was rescued by his parents before firefighters and paramedics arrived. He suffered minor bumps and bruises and was listed in stable condition at the hospital. The cheetahs did not approach the boy or his parents. The zoo plans to press child endangerment charges against the family.

A speed camera, previously used to enforce a 30mph speed limit, has been turned to point at a house in Handsworth, Birmingham. The camera has not been working for two years, as all fixed devices were switched off in the West Midlands in March 2013. The camera may be removed completely. There are plans for a pilot at a limited number of sites, using digital technology, but the camera in Wellington Road is not included in the pilot.
Usain Bolt will compete at the IAAF/BTC World Relays in the Bahamas on May 2 and 3 as part of the Jamaican team. He is fit, healthy and ready to run. The Jamaican team list will be announced shortly.

Neymar and Dani Alves supported Barcelona's basketball side at El Clasico, which Barca won 85-80. Real Madrid remains top of their Euro League division. Neymar helped Brazil beat Chile 1-0. Before the international break, Barcelona won their El Clasico contest. Neymar and his Barcelona team-mates return to La Liga on Sunday.

Italy is experiencing a rise in migrants from Africa and the Middle East. From Friday to Monday, 8,480 migrants were rescued. There are fears that 400 migrants could be missing after a ship carrying 550 people capsized. The Italian coast guard has not confirmed the incident. There has been an increase in migrant boats crossing the Mediterranean into Italy. Italy registered more than 10,000 migrants arriving in the first three months of 2015. At least 480 migrants have died while crossing the Mediterranean since the beginning of the year.

Arsene Wenger does not know why Alexis Sanchez chose Arsenal over Liverpool. Sanchez had a choice of clubs after Barcelona decided to let him leave. Wenger admits Liverpool could have used their interest in Sanchez as leverage during negotiations over Luis Suarez's move to Barcelona. Sanchez has made an instant impact in English football, scoring 19 goals so far this season. Wenger believes Sanchez is one of the best around. Wenger has played down talk of a potential summer transfer move for Liverpool forward Raheem Sterling.

Sir Bradley Wiggins will attempt to break cycling's hour record on June 7 at London's Olympic Velodrome. The current record is 52.491km, set by Australian Rohan Dennis. Tickets for the event go on sale April 19.

Serena Williams, a two-time French Open champion, struggled to beat Sara Errani in the Fed Cup, winning 4-6, 7-6(3), 6-3. The US team was beaten 3-2, with Williams and Alison Riske losing in doubles. Williams said the match was an "eye-opener" and that she is not as ready for the clay court season as she thought. The US team was relegated to World Group II.

River Plate are interested in signing Radamel Falcao, who played for them for eight years before leaving in 2009. River Plate vice president Matias Patanian said that they 'dream of Falcao' and that 'the doors are open'. Falcao has struggled on loan at Manchester United, scoring four Premier League goals. Falcao has scored 34 goals in 90 appearances for River Plate.

Ella Henderson, a 19-year-old X Factor finalist and pop star, is the official face of Batiste's 2015 'Ready For It' campaign. This is her first brand collaboration. The campaign features Henderson with various hairstyles against a blurred city background. The partnership was fused together by the MILES agency and launched with a TV ad featuring her single, Mirror Man. Henderson uses the product regularly.

Aaron Siler was fatally shot by officer Pablo Torres after Siler allegedly armed himself with a weapon. A billboard featuring Torres and his dog was erected by the Kenosha Professional Police Association to thank the community for its support. Siler's family and friends are in shock and have called the billboard disrespectful, feeling it was a thank you for killing Siler. Siler was wanted on an active felony probation and parole warrant and was shot after a vehicle and foot pursuit. Torres was also involved in another shooting 10 days prior where he wounded Terry Knight, who was armed with two knives. The investigation into Siler's death continues.

Eight Iranian border guards were killed in clashes with militants near the border with Pakistan. Three militants were killed by Iranian forces. The militants crossed into Iran from Pakistan. A militant group called Jaish al Adal claimed responsibility for the attack. Jaish al Adal is an anti-Iranian group that has targeted Shiites and says it aims to thwart Iranian influence in Pakistan. The Pakistani government condemned the attack and said they are investigating the incident.

The classic video game "Space Invaders" is the topic of a political discussion in Japan. Japan's Air Self Defense Force has never encountered an extraterrestrial unidentified flying object. Defense Minister Gen Nakatani told the Diet that his jets had never come across any UFOs from outer space. Former wrestler-turned-lawmaker Antonio Inoki asked if aircraft were ever scrambled to meet extraterrestrial threats, and if research was being done into alien visitors. Inoki also claims to have seen a UFO.

A 35-year-old passenger, Jin Pai, was hospitalized with deep cuts on his leg and buttocks after breaking a toilet he was squatting on in Hefei Xinqiao International Airport. He was standing on the rim of the toilet because he was worried about cleanliness. The toilet broke, and he was found bleeding on the floor. He received several dozen stitches at a Hefei hospital. He initially confessed to squatting on the toilet but later changed his story to police. Authorities believe the incident was an accident.

Kevin Rebbie, 56, of Limerick Township, Pennsylvania, was arrested after a 15-year-old girl found a hidden camera in her bathroom. Rebbie allegedly sexually abused the girl in her home over a four-year period and filmed her and others with the hidden camera. He faces several charges, including aggravated indecent assault, unlawful contact with a minor, sexual abuse of children and invasion of privacy. Investigators found 41 videos from the hidden camera, some of which included close-up images of children's genitalia. Rebbie admitted to filming several victims, including other juveniles. His preliminary hearing is on May 1 and he is being held on a $500,000 bail.

Japanese photographer Yûki Aoyama's latest series of images capture teenagers next to their fathers leaping into the air. The daughter looks directly into the camera smiling while her father pulls a dramatic pose. The images are from the 37-year-old's latest book which roughly translates into Daughter and Salary Man. The images allow the father to express his fun side. Each dad is in a sharply dressed suit. The images see the fathers pull energetic poses despite their age. Each photograph sees the daughter wearing casual clothing with her father in a sharp suit. The pictures see the families pose in front of various Japanese landmarks.

Paul Downton was dismissed as England's managing director. Kevin Pietersen posed for a Surrey team photo, looking in deep thought but also jovial. Pietersen's return to the England team is closer due to Downton's sacking. Pietersen last played for England during the last Ashes tour in Australia. He has rejoined Surrey to try to get back into the Test team.

Ceahlaul Piatra Neamt, a Romanian club, sacked Brazilian coach Ze Maria for the second time in a week. He was initially fired on Wednesday, then reinstated, and then fired again after a 2-0 loss to FC Botosani. Ze Maria was capped 25 times by Brazil and replaced Florin Marin in January. He will be replaced by Serbian Vanya Radinovic.

Radamel Falcao's former teammate believes Falcao must be regretting his failed loan move to Manchester United. Falcao moved to Manchester United on a season-long loan but has struggled to hit the heights he achieved before a knee injury. Manchester United are unlikely to make the transfer permanent. Falcao was not happy in France but his former teammate thinks he would have been better off staying at Monaco.

A tall man wearing a cartoon mask and a fluoro orange sweatshirt robbed a Christchurch dairy on Saturday, taking the till and about $1500 in cash. The man demanded cash from the owner's daughter, who ran out of the shop screaming. Police are asking for the public's help to identify the robber.

Kaitlyn Granado, a 24-year-old math teacher at MacArthur High School in Irving, Texas, was arrested for having sex with a 15-year-old pupil in her car on two consecutive nights in January. She was previously arrested on March 19 for an inappropriate relationship with another 15-year-old student, where she admitted to kissing him and letting him touch her breasts. She was suspended from teaching and put on administrative leave. She was arrested again on Monday and released after posting a $50,000 bail.

A video of a crocodile swimming through a public marina in Puerto Vallarta, Mexico, with a dead dog in its mouth has been viewed more than 500,000 times. The dog belonged to the local bike shop owner. The crocodile held onto the dog for hours. Crocodiles are common in Puerto Vallarta and live in a nearby sanctuary.

Steve Bruce is confident he can keep Hull City in the Premier League despite a 2-0 defeat by Southampton. Hull have only won six games this season, and Bruce hopes eight or nine wins will be enough to survive. They are two points clear of the drop zone with six games left, including tough fixtures against Liverpool, Arsenal, Tottenham and Manchester United. Bruce attributes their struggles to long-term injuries to key players. Southampton moved to fifth in the table after the win, but manager Ronald Koeman had to address a penalty dispute within his squad.

A teacher, Ian Guffick, was banned from the classroom after he let pupils change their exam answers, invalidating his whole school's SATs results. Guffick asked pupils to make changes to the national curriculum tests for 11-year-olds after the exam session had finished. He also altered some answers himself. The Department for Education annulled all SATs exam results for the entire school. Guffick admitted the allegations and accepted it amounted to unacceptable professional conduct. He was banned from the classroom for at least two years.

Anders Lindegaard, Manchester United goalkeeper, married Swedish model Misse Beqiri last year in Mauritius. They have a son together and have been dating since 2012. Lindegaard has struggled for playing time at Manchester United since joining in 2010, making only 19 league appearances in five seasons. Beqiri has over 17,000 followers on Instagram and regularly posts modeling photos.

The 13 glowing blue letters that once lit the Bronx from above Yankee Stadium failed to find a buyer at a Sotheby's auction. The letters were expected to bring in $300,000 to $600,000, but the only bid was $260,000 from a Sotheby's employee. The current owner of the letters is Yankee Hall of Famer Reggie Jackson, who purchased them after the stadium saw its final game in 2008. The letters had been at Yankee Stadium since 1976. In addition to the letters, a New York Mets bullpen car from the late 60s was auctioned off for $112,500.

Liverpool manager Brendan Rodgers spoke to Raheem Sterling and Jordon Ibe about their professional responsibilities after Sterling was exposed for inhaling nitrous oxide and both were pictured with shisha pipes. Neither player will be disciplined. Steven Gerrard is available for the FA Cup semi-final. Rodgers wants to focus on getting Liverpool to the FA Cup final.

Mesut Ozil returned to London after international duty, where Germany beat Georgia 2-0. He posted a picture on Twitter relaxing with his dog. Ozil missed Arsenal's last game due to illness but is expected to start against Liverpool. He has been in good form since returning from injury, with four assists and three goals since January. Ozil says he is adjusting to English football and fits in perfectly.

Barcelona club president Josep Maria Bartomeu says they have no plans to replace Luis Enrique and are 'very happy' with him. Enrique took charge last summer, signing a two-year deal, and is close to winning the title. Bartomeu says he's impressed with how the manager has performed. Enrique has a contract until 2016. Barcelona are still capable of winning three trophies. Barcelona beat Valencia with goals from Luis Suarez and Lionel Messi.

Jordan Henderson has agreed to a new long-term contract with Liverpool, worth around £100,000-a-week, that will run until 2020. He is the third big player to agree a contract extension, following Daniel Sturridge and Philippe Coutinho. Henderson could replace Steven Gerrard as Liverpool captain. Talks with Raheem Sterling are not expected to resume until the end of the season.

Filipe Luis wants to stay at Chelsea until the end of his contract, despite Atletico Madrid considering bringing him back. Luis signed a three-year contract last July. Chelsea manager Jose Mourinho is asking his players to be focused and concentrate in the matches.

Nathan Hughes's three-match ban for a collision with George North was overturned on appeal. Hughes was initially suspended for being reckless when his knee collided with North's head, resulting in a red card. The appeal panel concluded that the incident was accidental and no foul play occurred. North was knocked unconscious and advised to take a month off.

A fiery sunset was seen in Washington Sunday, caused by smoke from wildfires in Siberia. The fires were started by farmers burning grass and spread due to strong winds. The smoke was carried by winds across the Pacific Ocean to the Pacific Northwest, causing intense red sunsets due to smoke particles filtering out shorter wavelength colors from sunlight. As the smoke dissipates, the sunsets will lose their reddish hue.

Becky Schoenig's brand new 2015 Ford Fusion was stolen from her driveway. Police found her car after receiving a tip and returned it to her with red rims, red detailing, and orange accents on the steering wheel. Schoenig was not upset and posted a photo of her car on Facebook, thanking the car thieves for "pimping out" her vehicle. She is getting the car professionally cleaned due to the smell of cigarettes and marijuana and is creating a smoothie to honor the man who located her car.

Manchester City players will lose £500,000 each in bonuses if they fail to qualify for the Champions League this season. The team is currently in fourth place, and the top three finishers in the Premier League qualify automatically for the Champions League. The fourth-place team must win a qualifying round to join them. The City squad has around £12 million resting on reaching their European target. Manchester United is now four points ahead of City after their victory in the Manchester derby.

Manchester United's Under 18s defeated Manchester City 1-0 in the 'mini-derby' with a free-kick goal from Callum Gribbin. 13 of the 22 players were English, with 10 being Mancunian. The match was played at Altrincham's stadium with free entry and around 1,000 attendees. United are now two points behind Middlesbrough with a game in hand, while City have lost both matches in the play-off series.

Joe Hart called Gianluigi Buffon a 'legend of the game' after Buffon earned his 147th cap. Hart, who earned his 50th cap, said Buffon was an inspiration. Hart wants to keep playing well for his club and country.

Chipotle is partnering with Postmates to offer delivery in 67 cities, with a nine percent service charge and delivery fees starting at $5. Chipotle previously turned down offers from other delivery services. Other franchises such as Starbucks, Taco Bell, McDonald's and Burger King are also exploring delivery options. Presidential candidates Marco Rubio and Hillary Clinton have been spotted at Chipotle restaurants.

The parents of the youngest victim of the Boston Marathon bombings are asking for the death penalty to be dropped for Dzhokhar Tsarnaev, who was convicted on all 30 charges related to the bombings. The parents, Bill and Denise Richard, lost their 8-year-old son, Martin, and their daughter, Jane, was severely injured. They are asking for Tsarnaev to spend the rest of his life in prison without any possibility of release and waiving all of his rights to appeal. They believe that pursuing the death penalty would bring years of appeals and prolong reliving the most painful day of their lives.

A Boeing 747 was converted into a luxury home for a billionaire, costing £400 million. It includes bedrooms, lounges, a dining room, a kitchen, and an aeroloft with eight beds. The plane can hold dozens of guests, and has a conference room, office, and relaxation areas.

SpaceX launched a Falcon 9 rocket carrying a Dragon spacecraft to the International Space Station. The rocket's first stage attempted to land on a barge but was unsuccessful, landing too hard and tipping over. The Dragon will deliver supplies to the ISS and return with experiments and trash. This is SpaceX's sixth mission to the ISS.

Priscilla Presley will be a witness at the first wedding at the new Elvis Presley's Graceland Wedding Chapel in Las Vegas. The winning couple of a contest will get married at the chapel on April 23. The couple will also receive a free wedding reception, hotel suite, airfares, and concert tickets. Priscilla Presley was involved in the look and feel of the chapel and has stated that there will be no impersonators.

Liverpool vice-captain Jordan Henderson thinks his side could catch Manchester City in the Premier League. Henderson and Liverpool goalkeeper Simon Mignolet both played their 47th game of the season in the 2-0 win over Newcastle United. Raheem Sterling opened the scoring in the ninth minute and Joe Allen scored his first Anfield goal to make it 2-0. Liverpool are four points behind Manchester City.

Roma ended their four-month home winless streak with a victory over Napoli in Serie A. Miralem Pjanic scored for Roma in the 25th minute. Roma goalkeeper Morgan de Sanctis made many saves in the second half. Roma moved four points ahead of Lazio. Napoli's winless streak was extended to five matches. Residents of the Campania region were barred from buying tickets for the match. There were no reports of problems.

Doncaster Rovers have had an uninspired season and are in mid-table in League One. Their recent game against Fleetwood Town was a goalless draw. The match highlights video was only 27 seconds long, with 14 seconds of match action.

A man interacts with his blood parrot cichlid by stroking and massaging it. The fish initially moves away but returns to the man's hand to be stroked. The man began interacting with the fish after removing two other fish that were bullying it. The fish now enjoys being stroked and will become frustrated if the man doesn't play with it daily. The blood parrot cichlid is a hybrid of the midas and the redhead cichlid and was first bred in Taiwan around 1986.

Ben Stokes broke his wrist punching a locker at the Kensington Oval last year. He has a reputation as a fiery character, and clashed with Marlon Samuels during the second Test. England coach Peter Moores talked to Stokes after the clash. Stokes needs to control his aggression, but England do not want to quash his natural exuberance. England want Stokes in the team as much as possible to help him hit his full potential.

Wales' Euro 2016 qualifier against Belgium on June 12 at the Cardiff City Stadium is a 33,000 sell-out. Both teams have 11 points in Group B, with Belgium in first place due to goal difference. Wales' 3-0 victory over Israel has raised expectations for qualifying for the 2016 finals in France. The Wales squad prefers to play at the Cardiff City Stadium rather than the Millennium Stadium.

England's Under-17 team, coached by John Peacock, will compete in the UEFA European Under-17 Championship in Bulgaria. They are the defending champions and had a 100% record in qualifying. They are in Group D with Holland, Italy, and the Republic of Ireland. Their first match is against Italy on May 7. The squad includes players from various Premier League clubs, including Jay Dasilva and Ike Ugbo of Chelsea, and Chris Willock and Stephy Mavididi of Arsenal. Herbie Kane and Trent Arnold of Liverpool have been recalled to the squad.

Manchester City are interested in signing 14-year-old Anderlecht playmaker Evangelos Patoulidis, who is also being scouted by Arsenal and Barcelona. Patoulidis rejected a move to Barcelona when he was 12. Manchester City have held discussions with Anderlecht to agree a compensation package.

A 33-year-old transgender escort, Vanessa Santillan, was found dead in a flat in Fulham, London, at the end of March. She had been strangled and beaten to death. A 23-year-old man was arrested in connection with her death but has been bailed. Police are appealing for anyone who had contact with her in the hours before her death to come forward.

Dawn, a woman who suffered seven miscarriages, was distressed after her friend Jamie stole £207 that was set aside for her babies' grave stone. A lie detector test on The Jeremy Kyle show revealed that Jamie had taken the money. Jamie had also sent a Facebook message to Dawn confessing to taking the money but blamed it on his girlfriend Carol. Dawn was left feeling betrayed.

ISIS released over 200 Yazidis, mostly women and children, with the rest being ill or elderly. Arab tribal leaders helped coordinate the release. The Yazidis were received by Peshmerga and sent to Irbil. The exact motivation for the release is unclear. ISIS previously released other Yazidis. ISIS attacked Yazidi towns last year, forcing many from their homes and causing a humanitarian crisis. Yazidis are of Kurdish descent and their religion is considered a pre-Islamic sect. ISIS has been extraordinarily cruel to them, with reports of slaughter, rape, and enslavement. An international coalition responded with airdrops, rescues, and airstrikes. There are an estimated 500,000 Yazidis in northern Iraq.

Harry Kane is nominated for both the PFA Player and Young Player of the Season awards. He is featured in a new animation which shows some of his best goals and celebrations from the season. The video is entitled 'Harry Kane - PFA Player of the Year?' and has been released ahead of the awards ceremony on Sunday.

Jamie Carragher believes Brendan Rodgers is still the right man to lead Liverpool, despite a season with no trophies and a likely finish outside the top four. Carragher received a Beacon Award for his community work on Merseyside. Carragher hopes to give youngsters a lift and extra push to realize their goals.

Four-year-old James Hayward had his toy nerf gun confiscated at East Midlands Airport after it was deemed a security risk. Security officers performed a pat down of the child and confiscated the toy, which fires sponge darts. The boy's father labeled the security checks 'ludicrous'. East Midlands Airport apologized for the inconvenience but stated that regulations prohibit items that resemble a prohibited item. The family bought a replacement toy gun after returning from their holiday.

A man named Rich, 31, from Humpty Doo, Northern Territory, posted an advertisement on Gumtree seeking a girlfriend/wife. He requires a non-drinking, non-smoking, fit, attractive, reliable, honest, loyal woman who is good around the house, good with her hands, a good cook, and great in bed. She must enjoy the outdoors but also be a princess when needed. He is athletic, white, heavily tattooed, with brown hair and eyes, doesn't drink, smoke, or do drugs, likes traveling, the outdoors, sports, fishing, and camping. He is 175cm tall, well-endowed, owns property, makes good money, and loves cars and bikes. He is offering accommodation, a possible company car, phone, laptop, free gym membership, and a phone of her choice to the successful candidate. He is not shy of spending money on his woman and will consider all reasonable offers. Former partners need not apply.

Greg Dyke wants to increase the minimum number of home-grown players in club squads from eight to 12 and change the rules so that 'home-grown' means having trained in England for three years before the age of 18 rather than before 21. Five former England managers have backed Dyke's proposals, warning the English game will suffer if they are blocked. They also state that the pool of English talent playing at the very top level is shrinking.

Demelza Poldark is now the mother to a new baby daughter. In the next episode, Ross Poldark will be seen gazing at his new baby daughter. The timeline of the pregnancy is not convincing, as Demelza goes from announcing her pregnancy to being eight months pregnant in the next episode, and then gives birth shortly after. This is similar to a previous pregnancy on the show where Elizabeth went to full term between two episodes.

Leicester manager Nigel Pearson has urged his players to focus on their own job and not worry about their relegation rivals. Leicester is three points from safety after back-to-back wins. Jamie Vardy scored an injury-time winner against West Bromwich Albion. Pearson wants his side to remain focused on their own jobs.

A North Pacific gray whale named Varvara completed the longest migration of a mammal ever recorded, swimming nearly 14,000 miles. Varvara traveled from Russia's Sakhalin Island to Baja, Mexico, surpassing the previous record held by a humpback whale. Varvara visited three major breeding areas for eastern gray whales, suggesting she may be an eastern gray whale, not a western gray whale.

Overnight, 1,000ft of seabed rose to the surface on the east coast of Japan's Hokkaido Island, near the town of Rausu. The new coastline, which rose 30 to 50ft in some places, is believed to be the result of a landslide caused by melting ice and snow. The land mass measures roughly 1,000-1,640ft long and 100ft wide. Local residents did not hear any sounds or feel any tremors when the land appeared. Authorities do not expect the land to expand further and believe it is unrelated to the recent earthquake in Kathmandu. Marine organisms are still attached to the land mass.

Gregory van der Wiel has denied claims that he is set to leave Paris Saint-Germain in the summer and instead reiterated his 'love' for the club. Van der Wiel had a recent falling out with his boss Laurent Blanc after being dropped for the Champions League clash against Chelsea. Van der Wiel says he is happy in Paris and wants to sign a new contract. The Parisians continue to be linked with Barcelona star Dani Alves.

Carlos Tevez has been told to terminate his contract with Juventus to return to his former club Boca Juniors. Tevez's contract with Juventus does not expire until the end of next season, but he has told the club he wishes to leave this summer. Boca have confirmed they are close to completing a deal for the 31-year-old, but Tevez must terminate his contract with Juventus first. Tevez has always said he intends to finish his career back at his first club Boca Juniors in Argentina.

Bayern Munich manager Pep Guardiola ripped his trousers during a Champions League match against Porto, exposing his underwear. Bayern won the match 6-1, securing a place in the semi-finals. Goals were scored by Thiago Alcantara, Jerome Boateng, Thomas Muller, Xabi Alonso and Robert Lewandowski.

Ten people, including four children, were involved in a three-vehicle crash on the Brisbane Valley Highway, 2km south of Fernvale. A 40-year-old man and a five-year-old boy were flown to Princess Alexandra Hospital. A 27-year-old woman and a six-year-old girl were also being flown out. Six others were taken to Ipswich Hospital. One person was trapped in their vehicle and freed by emergency crews. The highway was closed with diversions in place.

Arsenal will play Chelsea this Sunday, and Arsenal player Mesut Ozil received a new Apple Watch. Ozil compared his watch to Michael Knight's watch from Knight Rider. Jack Wilshere recently returned from injury and was on the bench for the FA Cup semi-final. Ray Parlour believes Wilshere's fitness is the only thing holding him back.

Mark Clattenburg will referee the Manchester derby. He has sent off three players from United and City this season. Vincent Kompany was dismissed during Belgium's game against Israel and is suspended for the match against Wales. Clattenburg has sent off two United players this season. United are currently above City in the league.

Bob Katter accused the Queensland Government of believing Billy Gordon was a 'little black puppet on a string' and that they assumed he would quit after being accused of domestic violence and admitting to his criminal past. Katter, who is of Lebanese descent, said he has been personally subjected to racist attitudes and sympathized with Gordon's position. Gordon was forced to quit the Queensland Labor Party but will remain in parliament as an independent. Katter defended his statement, saying he used the term black puppet in light of his personal experiences.

Dayna Dobias, 19, from Downers Grove, Illinois, was born with cerebral palsy. She creates videos of herself dancing to inspire others and challenge stereotypes about disabilities. She hopes to change how people with disabilities are represented in media. She also does motivational speaking at local schools.

Orlando City have expressed interest in Manchester United's Javier Hernandez, who would be a big commercial draw for the club. Orlando have a large Latin-American fanbase. Hernandez is also being pursued by eight European sides. Manchester United have made a revised contract offer to Andreas Pereira, who has interest from other European clubs.

A group of at least three people poured gasoline on a car at a gas station in South Los Angeles and set it on fire. The driver of the car had an argument with the suspects while pumping gas. The suspects attempted to carjack the man before pouring gasoline on the car and lighting it on fire. There were two passengers inside the car at the time. No one was injured, but the car was completely ruined. The Los Angeles County Fire Department is investigating the incident as an arson.

A chiropractor in southern Iowa, Charles Manuel, surrendered his state license after admitting to accepting sex as payment for services and performing exorcisms on patients. He also recommended patients stop taking prescribed medication. Despite this, he received positive patient satisfaction reviews on HealthGrades.com. He cannot apply for reinstatement for at least 10 years and must prove the circumstances surrounding the revocation no longer exist before resuming practice.

A U.S. RC-135U reconnaissance plane was intercepted by a Russian SU-27 Flanker over the Baltic Sea in international airspace north of Poland. The U.S. called the Russian pilot's actions "unsafe and unprofessional" due to aggressive maneuvers. Russia claimed the U.S. plane was flying toward the Russian border with its transponder switched off, which the U.S. denies. The U.S. will file a petition with Russia through diplomatic channels. This is not the first time the U.S. has complained about an incident involving a RC-135U and a SU-27.

An FBI agent's sniper rifle was stolen from his car in a Salt Lake City hotel parking lot. The rifle was secured in a hard case with padlocks and chains, but the thief broke the car window, tied a rope to the case, and used another vehicle to rip it out. The agent's gear bag, backpack, clothing, and tools were also stolen. The theft occurred overnight, a week before President Obama's visit to Utah. The agent's bags and some clothing were found at a nearby hotel, but the rifle has not been recovered. The hotel where the theft occurred does not have surveillance cameras.

Luigi Costa, 71, is accused of killing his elderly neighbor Terrence Freebody in July 2012. Costa was believed to be suffering from dementia and alcohol abuse at the time. Forensic psychiatrist Professor Paul Mullen believes Costa's state of mind was declining in the lead-up to and during the incident. Costa's state of mind is critical to the case, as the jury can return a not guilty verdict if his unstable mindset at the time of the attack can be proven.

Everton manager Roberto Martinez defended Ross Barkley taking a penalty instead of Leighton Baines, who has a strong penalty record. Barkley's penalty was saved, but Everton still won the game 1-0. Martinez said he is happy to have multiple players who can take penalties.

Two passengers were found dead in their stateroom on the ms Ryndam cruise ship in Puerto Rico at 11:30 a.m. Thursday. The cruise line believes it was a murder-suicide. The FBI is investigating. The ship left Tampa, Florida, on March 29 for a 14-day Southern Caribbean cruise and is currently in San Juan, Puerto Rico. The cleaning staff discovered the deceased passengers.

Patrick Kluivert, former Holland forward and assistant coach, has made a winning start as coach of Curacao in World Cup qualifying. Curacao advanced to the second qualifying round in CONCACAF for the 2018 tournament, winning 4-3 on aggregate against Montserrat. Curacao will face Cuba in the next round on June 8 and 16.

Esteban Cambiasso has won all major European competitions but says keeping Leicester City in the Premier League would be up there with the best. Leicester is currently seven points adrift at the bottom of the table. Cambiasso says that helping keep Leicester in the Premier League will feel like winning a trophy. Cambiasso won 15 trophies during his time at Inter Milan. He signed for Leicester in the summer and is happy in the East Midlands.

Gemma, a 23-year-old mother of two, is at risk of being banned from seeing her children by her own mother, Debbie. Debbie has been caring for Gemma's children since they were four months old. Debbie is threatening to ban Gemma due to her drinking, partying, suspected drug use, and stealing. Gemma admits to stealing from her mother in the past. Debbie says Gemma's children call her mum and not grandma.

Chelsea forward Eden Hazard scored against Manchester United after a challenge by Chelsea captain John Terry on United striker Radamel Falcao. The Sky Sports punditry team agreed that Terry's challenge on Falcao should have been called a foul. Pundits Thierry Henry, Jamie Redknapp and Graeme Souness all agreed that play should have been stopped for Terry's tackle.

Lady Antebellum singer Hillary Scott's tour bus caught fire on a Texas freeway. Everyone on board was safely evacuated. The bus caught fire after a rear tire blew out. The fire destroyed everything in the bus's back lounge except her Bible. The band's other two members were not on the bus.

Dr. Adrian Quarterman is working on a laser that will convert sun beams into energy. The satellites will orbit the earth, covered in mirrors to help it harvest the sunlight and convert it into laser light. The energy it then creates can be shot back down to earth to boost the energy solar panels are receiving. Researchers in Tokyo have proposed a laser system to attach to the ISS which would be used to shoot down pieces of debris in Earth orbit. Dr. Quarterman has acknowledged you 'might possibly have to worry a bit about who is in control' of his satellites.

Stephen Munden, 54, a convicted paedophile with an obsession with young girls, has gone missing from a psychiatric unit. He was last seen leaving a hospital near Hook, Hampshire. Munden was detained under the Mental Health Act after sexually touching a three-year-old girl. He is described as about 5ft 8ins tall, of a heavy build, and has dark hair. He may have shaved off his beard. Munden was convicted of sexually touching a child under the age of 13 and had admitted to possessing indecent images of children. He has learning difficulties and is autistic.

V. Stiviano was ordered to pay back more than $2.6 million in gifts after being sued by Donald Sterling's wife, Rochelle "Shelly" Sterling. Shelly accused Stiviano of targeting wealthy older men and claimed Donald Sterling used their money to buy Stiviano a Ferrari, two Bentleys, a Range Rover, and a $1.8 million duplex. Stiviano argued there was nothing wrong with Donald Sterling giving her gifts. Donald Sterling's downfall came after an audio recording surfaced of him arguing with Stiviano about her posting pictures with African-Americans.

Thierry Henry believes Arsenal need to purchase four top players in the summer: a goalkeeper, centre back, defensive midfielder and striker. He also stated that Arsenal will struggle to win the league if Olivier Giroud remains as the club's first choice striker. Henry believes Arsenal need to sign players of a similar calibre to Thibaut Courtois, Nemanja Matic, Cesc Fabregas and Diego Costa.

A young woman was abused for years by Bega Cheese boss Maurice Van Ryn. Van Ryn has pleaded guilty to 12 sex offenses, including persistent sexual abuse of a child. The victim stated she is scared for her future relationships and didn't understand why she was targeted. She didn't speak up about the abuse until she heard he had been caught. She has suffered depression since she was 14 and had been hospitalized for self harm and attempted suicide.

Serge Gnabry is feeling better as he prepares to return after more than a year out due to a serious knee injury. The 19-year-old midfielder impressed for the Gunners last season. He has not featured for the first team since March 2014, but recently played 90 minutes for Arsenal Under 21s against Reading. He is now over his injury worries.

Jacob Phillips, a 23-year-old accountant, died after falling down a 70ft cliff while running from a taxi to avoid paying the fare. He and his friends had been out drinking and did not have enough money to pay for the taxi. He ran off in the dark, became disoriented, and fell off the cliff. His body was found the next day by a dog walker. The coroner recorded a verdict of accidental death.

Thousands of holidaymakers caught up in passport delays have not received compensation, while managers at the passport agency received bonuses. Ministers refused to give refunds to families who paid extra to get their passports rushed or missed trips. The passport office made a £42 million profit during the chaos. Only 2,191 compensation applications were approved, with an average payout of £92.68. The Passport Office could not say how many claims were rejected. Ministers rejected a demand to compensate all those left out of pocket.

A timewarp home from the 1930s is for sale in Bristol with original features including stained-glass windows, oil-fired central heating, and retro food jars. The semi-detached property has a guide price of between £200,000 and £250,000. It has the original bathroom, kitchen, wood-paneled hallway, and vintage cupboards. The house also has original tins of produce from the past. While some features have been upgraded, the potential cost of renovations could deter developers. The house will be auctioned on April 30.

Colin Kaepernick began his career as a backup to Alex Smith, but became the 49ers' starter in the middle of the 2012 season after Smith suffered a concussion. He led the 49ers to their first Super Bowl appearance since 1994, losing to the Baltimore Ravens.
Soul Food is a 1997 American comedy-drama film produced by Kenneth `` Babyface '' Edmonds, Tracey Edmonds and Robert Teitel and released by Fox 2000 Pictures.

Anne Rice was born in New Orleans, spent much of her early life there before moving to Texas, and later to San Francisco. Route 495 is a 3.45 mi freeway in Hudson County, New Jersey that connects the New Jersey Turnpike at exits 16E and 17 in Secaucus to New York State Route 495 inside the Lincoln Tunnel in Weehawken, providing access to Midtown Manhattan.
Telemundo is an American Spanish-language terrestrial television network owned by Comcast through the NBCUniversal division NBCUniversal Telemundo Enterprises.

Damon Albarn was raised in Leytonstone, East London and around Colchester, Essex. He attended the Stanway School, where he met Graham Coxon and formed Blur. Blur's debut album Leisure was released in 1991. Albarn's debut solo studio album Everyday Robots was released on 28 April 2014.
Mogadishu, also known as Hamar, is the capital and most populous city of Somalia. Many important national institutions are based in Mogadishu.
"Happiness in Slavery" is a song by Nine Inch Nails from their EP, Broken (1992).
Andrew Kevin Walker, born August 14, 1964, is an American BAFTA-nominated screenwriter.

The 2007 film Shooter follows Force Recon veteran Bob Lee Swagger, who is framed for murder. The Shooter TV series stars Ryan Phillippe as Bob Lee Swagger, an expert marksman who is coaxed back into action after learning of a plot to kill the president.
House, also called House, M.D., is an American television medical drama that originally ran on the Fox network for eight seasons, from November 16, 2004 to May 21, 2012.

Charles Manson was found guilty of first-degree murder and conspiracy to commit murder for the deaths of seven people, including Sharon Tate. He also received first-degree murder convictions for the deaths of Gary Hinman and Donald ``Shorty'' Shea. Recordings of songs written and performed by him were released commercially after he was charged with the crimes.

Sean Justin Penn, born August 17, 1960, is an American actor, filmmaker, and political activist. He began his acting career in television in 1974 and his film career in 1981. He received critical attention for his roles in the crime dramas At Close Range, State of Grace, and Carlito's Way. He became a prominent leading actor with the drama Dead Man Walking, for which he earned his first Academy Award nomination. He received two more Oscar nominations before winning his first Academy Award for Best Actor in 2003 for Mystic River and a second one in 2008 for Milk.

Sir Donald George `` Don '' Bradman, AC, was an Australian cricketer, often referred to as `` The Don '', and is widely acknowledged as the greatest batsman of all time. After his retirement, Bradman remained in the game as an administrator, selector and writer for three decades.
L.A. Reid has served as the chairman and CEO of Epic Records, the president and CEO of Arista Records, and the chairman and CEO of the Island Def Jam Music Group.

Brad Wilk is best known as the drummer of Rage Against the Machine and Audioslave. He started his career as a drummer for Greta in 1990 and co-founded Rage with Tom Morello and Zack de la Rocha in August 1991. As of 2016, he is playing in the band Prophets of Rage. Rage is also a German heavy metal band formed in 1984 by Peter Wagner.
The Millers aired from October 3, 2013 to July 18, 2015, with 34 episodes over two seasons on CBS. CBS canceled The Millers on November 14, 2014, four episodes into the second season.

Dorothy Ann Willis Richards was an American politician and the 45th Governor of Texas from 1991 to 1995. She was a Democrat and first came to national attention as the state treasurer of Texas. She was defeated for re-election in 1994 by George W. Bush. She was the second female governor of Texas. Ann Richards was an American jazz singer and the wife of pianist Stan Kenton.
Drake Bell released an EP in 2011 called A Reminder independently.

Boardwalk is a 1979 American drama film written by Stephen Verona and Leigh Chapman and directed by Verona. Janet Leigh was an American actress, singer, dancer and author who wrote four books between 1984 and 2002, including two novels.

Simón José Antonio de la Santísima Trinidad Bolívar y Palacios, known as El Libertador, was a Venezuelan military and political leader who played a leading role in the establishment of Venezuela, Bolivia, Colombia, Ecuador, Peru and Panama as sovereign states, independent of Spanish rule.

The Bermuda Triangle, also known as the Devil's Triangle, is a loosely-defined region in the western part of the North Atlantic Ocean, where a number of aircraft and ships are said to have disappeared under mysterious circumstances.

Colin Kaepernick began his career as a backup to Alex Smith, but became the 49ers' starter in the middle of the 2012 season. He led the 49ers to their first Super Bowl appearance since 1994, losing to the Baltimore Ravens. During the 2013 season, Kaepernick helped the 49ers reach the NFC Championship, losing to the Seattle Seahawks.
Marnie is a 1964 American psychological thriller film directed by Alfred Hitchcock.

Advertising is a marketing communication that uses a nonpersonal message to promote or sell a product, service, or idea. It is communicated through various mass media, including old media such as newspapers, magazines, television, radio, outdoor advertising, or direct mail; or new media such as search results, blogs, websites, or text messages.
Private Lives is a 1930 comedy of manners in three acts by Noël Coward. Private Lives is a 1931 American Pre-Code comedy film directed by Sidney Franklin.

Maurice Harold Macmillan, 1st Earl of Stockton, was a British Conservative politician and statesman who served as the Prime Minister of the United Kingdom from 10 January 1957 to 19 October 1963. He was born on 10 February 1894 and died on 29 December 1986.

Aristotle was an ancient Greek philosopher and scientist born in Stagira. He joined Plato's Academy in Athens at seventeen or eighteen and remained there until the age of thirty-seven. Shortly after Plato died, Aristotle left Athens and tutored Alexander the Great beginning in 343 BC.

David Mordechai Packouz, born February 16, 1982, is an American former arms dealer, musician, inventor, and entrepreneur. He invented the BeatBuddy, a guitar pedal drum machine, and is currently the CEO of Singular Sound, a music technology company.

Magic Johnson played point guard for the Lakers for 13 seasons. He was selected first overall in the 1979 NBA draft by the Lakers. He won a championship and an NBA Finals Most Valuable Player Award in his rookie season, and won four more championships with the Lakers during the 1980s. He retired, returned in 1996 to play 32 games, and then retired for the final time. He was named by Ebony magazine as one of America's most influential black businessmen in 2009 and has numerous business interests.

Tenacious D is an American comedy rock duo formed in Los Angeles, California in 1994. The band is composed of Jack Black and Kyle Gass. They have released three albums: Tenacious D (2001), The Pick of Destiny (2006), and Rize of the Fenix (2012). The band gained popularity in 1997 when they starred in their television series and began to support large rock acts.

James VI and I was King of Scotland from 24 July 1567 and King of England and Ireland from 24 March 1603 until his death. The kingdoms of Scotland and England were individual sovereign states, though both were ruled by James in personal union. He was a major advocate of a single parliament for England and Scotland. He faced great difficulties in England, including the Gunpowder Plot in 1605 and repeated conflicts with the English Parliament.

Big Brother 2017, also known as Big Brother 18, is the upcoming eighteenth series of the British reality television series Big Brother, hosted by Emma Willis and narrated by Marcus Bentley. Marcus Bentley is a British actor, broadcaster and voice-over artist, most famous for narrating the United Kingdom's version of Big Brother since 2000.

The Free State of Saxony is a landlocked federal state of Germany, bordering other German states, Poland, and the Czech Republic. It is the tenth largest of Germany's sixteen states, with an area of 18,413 km2, and the sixth most populous, with 4 million people. Saxony is a region for quality wine in Germany and is one of the northernmost wine regions in Europe.
East End Park is a former major league baseball park in Cincinnati. "In the End" is a song by Linkin Park.
Mel B. Brown began her solo career when she released "I Want You Back" with Missy Elliott on Virgin Records.
Noah Cyrus is the youngest daughter of Billy Ray Cyrus and younger sister of Miley Cyrus and Trace Cyrus.

Mohra is a 1994 Indian action thriller film directed by Rajiv Rai starring Akshay Kumar, Sunil Shetty, Raveena Tandon and Naseeruddin Shah. The film was released on 1 July 1994 and became the second highest grossing Indian film of 1994. The film got nine Filmfare nominations in 1995. Originally Divya Bharti was considered for the female lead, but after her death, Raveena Tandon was roped into the project as her replacement.
"Hourglass" is a song by British electronic duo Disclosure and also singer-songwriter James Taylor's fourteenth studio album.

Shane Black, born December 16, 1961, is an American screenwriter, director, producer and actor. He is known for writing the 1987 action film Lethal Weapon, and his directorial debut with the film Kiss Kiss Bang Bang in 2005.
A View to a Kill (1985) is the fourteenth spy film of the James Bond series, and the seventh and last to star Roger Moore as James Bond.

Papua is the largest and easternmost province of Indonesia, comprising most of western New Guinea. It was formerly called Irian Jaya, and before that West Irian or Irian Barat. It comprised all of Indonesian New Guinea.
Augustus probably died from natural causes, although there were unconfirmed rumors that his wife Livia poisoned him.

Jennifer Lopez began her music career in 1999 with her album On the 6. In 2001, she had a number one album and film in the same week. Her relationship with Ben Affleck influenced her third album. She married Marc Anthony and had box office successes. She gave birth to twins in 2008 and returned to prominence in 2011 with her appearance on American Idol and her single “On the Floor”.

Working animals are domesticated animals trained to perform tasks. They may be family members like guide dogs, provide tractive force like draft horses, or be used for milking or herding. Wild animals may be trained for novelty or entertainment, but lack the trustworthiness of domesticated working animals.

Billboard Dad is a 1998 American direct-to-video comedy film, directed by Alan Metter starring Mary-Kate and Ashley Olsen. Top Latin Albums is a record chart published by Billboard magazine for Spanish language albums in the American music market. The Regional Mexican Albums is a genre-specific record chart published weekly by Billboard magazine in the United States.
Vedam is a 2010 Telugu language Indian drama film written and directed by Radhakrishna Jagarlamudi, starring Allu Arjun, Manoj Manchu, and Anushka Shetty.
Men in Black II is a 2002 American science fiction action comedy film starring Tommy Lee Jones, Will Smith, Lara Flynn Boyle, Johnny Knoxville, Rosario Dawson, Tony Shalhoub and Rip Torn.

Sancho Panza is a fictional character in the novel Don Quixote written by Miguel de Cervantes Saavedra in 1605. Sancho is Don Quixote's squire and provides comments throughout the novel, known as sanchismos, that are a combination of humor, proverbs, and wit.
The Adventures of Pluto Nash is a 2002 Australian-American science fiction action comedy film starring Eddie Murphy and directed by Ron Underwood.
The world premiere of Hedda Gabler took place on 31 January 1891 at the Residenztheater in Munich, and Ibsen was present.
Brazzers is a pornographic production company based in Montreal, Canada.
Timothy Simon Roth, born on 14 May 1961, is an English actor and director.

Juventus Football Club, known as Juve, is a professional Italian football club based in Turin, founded in 1897 by young students. The club is the second oldest in Italy, has worn a black and white striped home kit since 1903, and plays home matches in the 41,507-capacity Juventus Stadium.

Viola Davis played supporting and minor roles in several films and television series in the late 1990s and early 2000s, including the films Kate & Leopold (2001) and Far from Heaven (2002), and the television series Law & Order: Special Victims Unit.

Jenna Jameson, born April 9, 1974, is an American entrepreneur, webcam model, and former pornographic film actress. She has been called the world's most famous adult entertainment performer and "The Queen of Porn". She started acting in erotic videos in 1993 after working as a stripper and glamor model.
The New Orleans Pelicans compete in the National Basketball Association (NBA) as a member of the league's Western Conference Southwest Division.

Starrcade was an annual professional wrestling event held from 1983 to 2000 by the NWA and later WCW. It was originally broadcast via closed-circuit television and eventually via pay-per-view. JCP held major wrestling events on Thanksgiving and Christmas. Starrcade (1985) was the third annual event produced by JCP under the NWA banner. Starrcade (1987) was the fifth annual event produced by JCP under the NWA banner. Starrcade (1997) was the fifteenth annual pay-per-view event.
Jack Ryan Falahee, born February 20, 1989, is an American actor. He is known for his role as Connor Walsh on How to Get Away with Murder and for playing Benjamin Stringfellow on Mercy Street.

Seohyun is a South Korean singer and actress, born on June 28, 1991. She debuted as a member of Girls' Generation in August 2007. She has also established herself as an actress. She debuted as a solo artist with her debut mini album, Do n't Say No, on January 17, 2017.

The Apple II is an 8-bit home computer, one of the first highly successful mass-produced microcomputer products, designed primarily by Steve Wozniak. The Apple II series is a family of home computers, one of the first highly successful mass-produced text command microcomputer products, designed primarily by Steve Wozniak, manufactured by Apple Computer and introduced in 1977. Stephen Gary Wozniak, nicknamed “Woz”, is an American inventor, electronics engineer, programmer, philanthropist, and technology entrepreneur who co-founded Apple Inc.

A&E is an American cable and satellite television channel. It is the flagship television property of A&E Networks, a joint venture between the Hearst Corporation and Disney -- ABC Television Group subsidiary of the Walt Disney Company. Both maintain a 50% ownership interest.

L.A. Reid has served as chairman and CEO of Epic Records, president and CEO of Arista Records, and chairman and CEO of the Island Def Jam Music Group. He was also the founder and CEO of Hitco Music Publishing and the co-founder of LaFace Records.
Veeram is a 2014 Indian Tamil action film directed by Siva and produced by Vijaya Productions. Veeram is also a 2016 Indian epic historical drama film written and directed by Jayaraj.

Home for the Holidays is a 1972 American made-for-television horror film directed by John Llewellyn Moxey, produced by Aaron Spelling and starring Sally Field, Eleanor Parker, Julie Harris, Jessica Walter and Walter Brennan which premiered on ABC on November 28, 1972. There is also a 1995 film titled Home for the Holidays starring Holly Hunter, Robert Downey Jr., Anne Bancroft, Charles Durning, Dylan McDermott, Geraldine Chaplin, Steve Guttenberg, Cynthia Stevenson, Claire Danes, Austin Pendleton and David Strathairn.
Taran Hourie Killam is an American actor, comedian, and writer, born on April 1, 1982.
The Sex Factor is an online reality TV series produced by xHamster where eight men and eight women compete to become a porn star.
John Hovig Dolmayan, born July 15, 1973, is a Lebanese-born Armenian-American songwriter and drummer.
Island Records is a British-American record label that operates as a division of Universal Music Group (UMG).
Sikkim is a northeastern state of India.
Christa McAuliffe took a teaching position as a social studies teacher at Concord High School in New Hampshire in 1983.
Ron Weasley is a fictional character in J. K. Rowling's Harry Potter series.
Reign Over Me is a 2007 American drama film written and directed by Mike Binder, and produced by his brother Jack Binder. It was distributed by Columbia Pictures and released on March 23, 2007.
Colin Kaepernick is an American football quarterback born on November 3, 1987, and is currently a free agent.
Sheryl Lee appeared in Café Society in 2016 and reprised her role of Laura Palmer in the 2017 Twin Peaks revival. Sheryl Lee Ralph played Madame Morrible in Wicked on Broadway in 2016.
Matteo Renzi is an Italian politician born on January 11, 1975. He served as the Prime Minister of Italy from February 2014 until December 2016.
The film The Road to El Dorado stars Kevin Kline, Kenneth Branagh, Armand Assante, Jim Cummings, Edward James Olmos, Tobin Bell and Rosie Perez.

"Same Old Love" is a song by Selena Gomez from her second studio album, Revival (2015). In 2015, she released Revival, which debuted at number one on the Billboard 200. The first three singles, "Good for You," "Same Old Love," and "Hands to Myself," all topped the Mainstream Top 40 chart in the United States.
Weekly Idol is hosted by comedian Jeong Hyeong-don and rapper Defconn.

Heavy metal is a genre of rock music that developed in the late 1960s and early 1970s, largely in the United Kingdom and the United States. In the late 1970s, bands in the new wave of British heavy metal such as Iron Maiden and Saxon followed in a similar vein.
Ashton Kutcher appeared in romantic comedies including Guess Who (2005), A Lot Like Love (2005), What Happens in Vegas (2008), and No Strings Attached (2011).

Topman is part of the Arcadia Group, which also owns Burton, Miss Selfridge, Wallis, Evans and Dorothy Perkins. The development of mining and metallurgical industries transformed Wales from an agricultural society into an industrial nation. The South Wales Coalfield's exploitation caused a rapid expansion of Wales' population.
Tool has won three Grammy Awards, performed worldwide tours, and produced albums topping the charts in several countries.
YouTube is an American video-sharing website headquartered in San Bruno, California. It is ranked as the second most popular site in the world by Alexa Internet.
Sidse Babett Knudsen is a Danish actress born on 22 November 1968. She works in theatre, television, and film.
Conrad Dunn began his screen career as Francis "Psycho" Soyer in Stripes (1981). Several actors including Conrad Dunn were featured in their first significant film roles in Stripes.
Raees is a film starring Shah Rukh Khan, Mahira Khan, and Nawazuddin Siddiqui.
Asylum Records is an American record label founded in 1971 by David Geffen and partner Elliot Roberts.
Trollhunters is an American computer-animated fantasy television series created for Netflix by Guillermo del Toro and produced by DreamWorks Animation and Double Dare You.

The Armenian Genocide was the Ottoman government's systematic extermination of 1.5 million Armenians, mostly Ottoman citizens. Other indigenous and Christian ethnic groups such as the Assyrians and the Ottoman Greeks were similarly targeted for extermination by the Ottoman government.
Marcus Morgan Bentley, born on 4 October 1967, is a British actor, broadcaster, and voice-over artist.

William Jefferson Clinton, born August 19, 1946, is an American politician who served as the 42nd President of the United States from 1993 to 2001. His first inauguration was held on January 20, 1993.

Danny Boyle, born October 20, 1956, is an English director, producer, screenwriter, and theatre director. He is known for his work on films including Shallow Grave, Trainspotting, The Beach, 28 Days Later, Sunshine, Slumdog Millionaire, 127 Hours, and Steve Jobs. Major Bruce Middleton Hope Shand MC and bar was an officer in the British Army, born on 22 January 1917 and died on 11 June 2006.

The Others (2001 film) won eight Goya Awards, including Best Film and Best Director. It was the first English-language film to receive the Best Film Award at the Goyas. The film was nominated for six Saturn Awards, and won three: Best Horror Film, Best Actress for Kidman, and Best Supporting Actress for Fionnula Flanagan.
Ralph Fults was a Depression-era outlaw and escape artist associated with Raymond Hamilton, Bonnie Parker and Clyde Barrow of the Barrow Gang. He was born January 23, 1911 and died March 16, 1993.

The 14th Dalai Lama, Tenzin Gyatso, was born Lhamo Thondup on July 6, 1935. He was selected as the tulku of the 13th Dalai Lama in 1937 and formally recognized as the 14th Dalai Lama in 1939. During the 1959 Tibetan uprising, the Dalai Lama fled to India, where he currently lives as a refugee.

Stephen Hillenburg was born in Lawton, Oklahoma and raised in Anaheim, California. He was fascinated with the ocean as a child and also developed an interest in art.

Mendicant religious orders include Catholic, Hindu, Sufi Islam, Jainism and Buddhism. A monk practices religious asceticism by monastic living, either alone or with other monks. A monk may dedicate his life to serving others or choose to live in prayer and contemplation.
The Mod Squad is an American crime drama series that ran on ABC from 1968 to 1973.
The Dark Tower is an upcoming American science fantasy western action horror film directed and co-written by Nikolaj Arcel.

Arizona is a state in the southwestern region of the United States. It is the sixth largest and the 14th most populous of the 50 states. Arizona is the 48th state and last of the contiguous states to be admitted to the Union, achieving statehood on February 14, 1912. Angela Bassett began her film career in the mid-1980s, after earning a bachelor of arts degree from Yale University and a master of fine arts degree from drama school.

The Congressional Space Medal of Honor is the highest award given by NASA, awarded by the President of the United States in Congress's name. Down with Love is a 2003 romantic comedy film.
Paul Nicholls is an actor known for his roles as Joe Wicks in BBC's EastEnders and as DS Sam Casey in ITV's Law & Order: UK.
Colombiana is a 2011 French action film co-written and produced by Luc Besson and directed by Olivier Megaton.
Rick Yune was part of the main cast of the Netflix original series Marco Polo until the series was cancelled on December 12, 2016.

Saturn Corporation, also known as Saturn LLC, is a registered trademark established on January 7, 1985, as a subsidiary of General Motors.

The Armenian Genocide was the Ottoman government's systematic extermination of 1.5 million Armenians. Turkey, the successor state of the Ottoman Empire, denies the word genocide as an accurate term for the mass killings of Armenians.
Muslims believe the Quran was verbally revealed by God to Muhammad through the angel Gabriel over approximately 23 years, beginning in 609 CE and concluding in 632.

The human brain, with the spinal cord, makes up the central nervous system. The brain consists of the cerebrum, the brainstem and the cerebellum. The cerebrum is the largest part of the human brain. Underneath the cerebral cortex, several important structures are located.
T2 Trainspotting is a 2017 British comedy drama film, set in and around Edinburgh, Scotland.

AMGTV is an American family-oriented television network featuring television programming consisting of drama, sports, movies, entertainment, how-to, hunting and fishing, children's shows, and other features.

Sir Donald George `` Don '' Bradman, also known as `` The Don '', was an Australian cricketer, considered the greatest batsman of all time. He was a national icon, and in 2001, Prime Minister John Howard called him the ``greatest living Australian''.

Margaret Hilda Thatcher was a British stateswoman who served as Prime Minister of the United Kingdom from 1979 to 1990 and as Leader of the Conservative Party from 1975 to 1990. She was the longest-serving British prime minister of the 20th century, and the first woman to have held the office. In 1975, Thatcher became the first woman to lead a major political party in the United Kingdom.

Randy Mario Poffo, known as "Macho Man" Randy Savage, was an American professional wrestler and color commentator. He was best known for his time in the World Wrestling Federation (WWF, now WWE) and later World Championship Wrestling (WCW). He was born November 15, 1952 and died May 20, 2011.
Alice Cooper, born Vincent Damon Furnier on February 4, 1948, is an American singer, songwriter, and actor with a career spanning over five decades.

EA Black Box, formerly Black Box Games, was a video game developer based in Burnaby, British Columbia, Canada. It was founded in 1998 by former employees of Radical Entertainment and later acquired by Electronic Arts (EA).

Baiae was a mineral springs and coastal resort on the northwest shore of the Gulf of Naples in ancient Italy. Herculaneum was an ancient Roman town destroyed by volcanic pyroclastic flows in 79 AD. There are numerous culturally and historically significant sites near Naples, including the Palace of Caserta and the Roman ruins of Pompeii and Herculaneum. There are famous ruins all over the world.

No Country for Old Men is a cat-and-mouse drama starring Tommy Lee Jones, Javier Bardem, and Josh Brolin. It follows a Texas welder and Vietnam veteran in the desert landscape of 1980 West Texas. Call in Lonesome Dove, Agent K in Men in Black, Sheriff Ed Tom Bell in No Country for Old Men, Two-Face in Batman Forever, William Strannix in Under Siege, a Texas Ranger in Man of the House, Pete Perkins in The Three Burials of Melquiades Estrada, Colonel Chester Phillips in Captain America: The First Avenger, Robert Dewey in Jason Bourne and Warden Dwight McClusky in Natural Born Killers.
Palo Alto is a charter city in the northwest corner of Santa Clara County, California, in the San Francisco Bay Area of the United States. The name Palo Alto means "tall tree".

Morse code is a method of transmitting text information as a series of on-off tones, lights, or clicks that can be understood by a skilled listener or observer without special equipment. The length of each character in Morse varies approximately inversely to its frequency of occurrence in English. Morse code is less sensitive to poor signal conditions than voice and can be sent by improvised methods.

The 2005 Hindu Kush earthquake hit northeastern Afghanistan with a magnitude of 6.5 on December 12 at 21:47 ( UTC ). The Hindu Kush is an 800 km mountain range that stretches near the Afghan-Pakistan border. The highest point in the Hindu Kush is Tirich Mir at 7708 m in the Chitral District of Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan.
As of 2015, Ripon College's student body stood at around 840, the majority of whom live on campus.

Fox Sports is a brand name for sports channels and other media controlled or partially owned by the family of Rupert Murdoch. Wildfang is a US-based women's apparel company that features tomboyish clothing.

Speech recognition (SR) is a sub-field of computational linguistics that develops methodologies and technologies that enables the recognition and translation of spoken language into text by computers. Sean Penn won two Academy Awards for his roles in Mystic River (2003) and Milk (2008). He became a leading actor with Dead Man Walking (1995), earning his first Academy Award nomination. He received two more Oscar nominations before winning his first Academy Award for Mystic River and a second for Milk. Volcanic outgassing created the primordial atmosphere and ocean, which contained almost no oxygen. The Earth cooled, forming a solid crust and allowing liquid water to exist. Plate tectonics shapes Earth's oceans and continents. Changes in the biosphere, now dominated by human activity, affect the atmosphere and other systems. Water covers 71% of the Earth's surface.
Nuuk, also known as Godthåb, is the capital and largest city of Greenland and the municipality of Sermersooq.

Miller, and Kristen Wiig, with the addition of Cate Blanchett, Djimon Hounsou, and Kit Harington. Martin Van Buren was an American politician who served as the eighth President of the United States from 1837 to 1841. He was a member of the Democratic Party and also served as the eighth Vice President and tenth Secretary of State under Andrew Jackson. Van Buren was a major supporter and organizer for Jackson in the 1828 election. After serving as governor for two months, Van Buren resigned to become Jackson's Secretary of State. Michigan is a state in the Great Lakes and Midwestern regions of the United States. It is the tenth most populous and has the 11th largest total area. Starrcade was an annual professional wrestling event held from 1983 to 2000 by the NWA and later WCW. It was originally broadcast via closed-circuit television and eventually via pay-per-view. The Freeport Doctrine was articulated by Stephen A. Douglas at the second of the Lincoln-Douglas debates on August 27, 1858, in Freeport, Illinois. The Soyuz is a series of spacecraft designed for the Soviet space program in the 1960s that remains in service today. The S&P BSE SENSEX is a free-float market-weighted stock market index of 30 companies listed on the Bombay Stock Exchange. Tata Motors is listed on the Bombay Stock Exchange, where it is a constituent of the BSE SENSEX index, the National Stock Exchange of India, and the New York Stock Exchange.

Vietnam is the easternmost country on the Indochina Peninsula in Southeast Asia. It has an estimated 92.7 million inhabitants, making it the world's 14th-most-populous country. Vietnam is bordered by China to the north, Laos to the northwest, and Cambodia to the southwest. Since 2000, Vietnam's economic growth rate has been among the highest in the world. Vietnam remains one of the world's four remaining one-party socialist states officially espousing communism.
Dreamer is a 2005 American sports drama film written and directed by John Gatins. It was Gatins' directorial debut.

James VI and I was King of Scotland from 24 July 1567 and King of England and Ireland from 24 March 1603 until his death. Valencia is the capital of the autonomous community of Valencia and the third largest city in Spain. It has around 800,000 inhabitants in the administrative center and a metropolitan area population ranging from 1.7 to 2.5 million. The Valencian Community is an autonomous community of Spain.

Speech recognition is a sub-field of computational linguistics that develops methodologies and technologies that enables the recognition and translation of spoken language into text by computers. It incorporates knowledge and research in the linguistics, computer science, and electrical engineering fields. Speech recognition applications include voice user interfaces, call routing, domotic appliance control, search, simple data entry, preparation of structured documents, speech-to-text processing, and aircraft. Many speech industry players have publicized the core technology in their speech recognition systems as being based on deep learning.

Richard Alf was an American businessman and former comic book store owner who co-founded the San Diego Comic-Con International and served as its chairman beginning in 1970. Sheikh Ali Salman stated that for national dialogue to be meaningful, the government needs to offer "concrete solutions" and have someone who can speak for the royal family. He believes that dialogue and negotiations are necessary. He acknowledged that many young protesters have lost faith in the main opposition parties, but the only way forward is to work with reformists within the Sunni Muslim royal family. He also stated that the crown prince and opposition had agreed to a seven-point plan that would have moved Bahrain towards a constitutional monarchy, but it was severed when GCC troops came in. He is hopeful that John Kerry will do more than his predecessor and that the US government needs to pressure harder for human rights and democratic practices. He also stated that the UK government needs to speak out publicly and that al-Wefaq will continue to call for "peaceful demonstrations". He also called for the release of 13 opposition leaders and human rights activists.

He died at his home in Cambridge after an illness. His funeral will be private, with a memorial service at a later date. He was an influential figure in early music, founding the Academy of Ancient Music (AAM) in 1973 and directing it for 30 years. The AAM made over 200 CDs, including the first complete Mozart symphonies on period instruments. He studied keyboard at Cambridge University and held positions at multiple universities. He was described as a great ambassador for historically informed music and a natural academic.

In the year ending March, there were 57 homicide victims, down five from the previous year and the lowest since 1976. As of March 31, 2016, only one homicide case from 2015-16 was unresolved. A sharp instrument was the most common method of killing, with 51% of homicides involving a knife. 31% of accused were identified as being under the influence of alcohol or drugs. While homicide cases have decreased, sexual crime is at a 45-year high and violent crime has increased. The number of homicide victims for 2014-15 was initially 59 but later increased to 62.

The Cherries lost 2-1 to Sunderland, becoming the first team to lose to them in the Premier League this season. Dan Gosling's goal was their first in three games. Bournemouth were unable to find an equaliser, even against 10 men. Howe said they had enough chances to win three games.

Mr. Abbott stated that the only way to prevent people dying at sea was to "stop the boats". Australia detains migrants trying to reach its shores by boat and takes them to offshore processing camps. The New York Times described the policy as "brutal". Mr. Abbott said the image of Alan Kurdi was "very sad" and that "if you want to stop the deaths, if you want to stop the drownings you have got to stop the boats". Mr. Abbott angered Australian Jewish groups by saying IS was worse than the Nazis. Mr. Abbott later said he stood by his comments, but that he was not in the "business of ranking evil".

Washington blames Russia and the Syrian government for attacks against civilians. The US suspended talks with Russia after Russia did not stop bombing Aleppo. Russia regrets the US move and accuses the US of shifting blame for the collapse of last month's truce. Aleppo has been under heavy aerial bombardment since the end of the ceasefire. A main trauma hospital in the rebel-held eastern part of the city was hit in an air strike for the third time in a week. Hundreds of people have died since government forces launched an offensive to take full control of Aleppo. The US said Russia failed to live up to its commitments and was unwilling to ensure Syrian regime adherence to the arrangements. Russia denies involvement in the deadly aid convoy strike. Russia says the US failed to improve the humanitarian condition around Aleppo and failed to divide jihadist groups in Syria from the moderate opposition. The US withdrew personnel that had been dispatched in anticipation of the possible establishment of the Joint Implementation Centre.

Policy Exchange suggests selling high-value social homes when they become vacant, which could raise £4.5bn a year to build 80,000 to 170,000 social homes. They argue that social housing would still exist in expensive areas, but there would be less of it. The think tank claims this could reduce the social housing waiting list by 500,000. Labour opposes the plan, stating it would drive out low-wage families and break up communities. They suggest using a bank bonus tax to fund 250,000 affordable homes. The government supports the idea, stating councils should use their housing stock efficiently. Critics argue this would push the least well-off out of expensive areas.
